Exploring Fourier Transforms

A fourier transform is a mathematical operation that converts a function from the time domain to the frequency domain. Here‚Äôs an example using the display mode of the MathJax package

\[ \frac{1}{2\pi} \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} f(t) e^{-i\omega t} dt \label{eq:fourier}. \]

This fourier transform concerns the two conjugate variables \(\omega\) and \(t\). This can be seen in equation (\ref{eq:fourier}) as a function of \(t\) and \(\omega\).
